intro: Solanum tuberosum var. vulgare, commonly known as the common potato, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its stolons, which produce tubers underground. The tubers are the economically important part of the plant, used as a staple food crop worldwide. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with simple, alternate leaves and small white or violet flowers. It thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
